newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia's international reserves fall slightly.
newsitem.headline: Colombia's international reserves fall slightly.

text.p: Colombia's net international reserves fell $30.3 million between August 10 and August 17 because of an increase in the central bank's liabilities in foreign currency, according to the most recent bank figures available.
The figures from the Banco de la Republica, or central bank, show the country's reserves totalling $8.03 billion as of August 16. The drop of $30.3 million was the first in five consecutive weeks.
Colombia's net international reserves in as of August 18, 1995, stood at $8.34 billion.
